      22                 :            :  * Compute the normal vectors of a layer in a map.
      23                 :            :  */
      24                 :            : template<typename T>
      25                 :          0 : class NormalVectorsFilter : public filters::FilterBase<T>
      26                 :            : {
      27                 :            : public:
      28                 :            :   /*!
      29                 :            :    * Constructor
      30                 :            :    */
      31                 :            :   NormalVectorsFilter();
      32                 :            : 
      33                 :            :   /*!
      34                 :            :    * Destructor.
      35                 :            :    */
      36                 :            :   ~NormalVectorsFilter() override;
      37                 :            : 
      38                 :            :   /*!
      39                 :            :    * Configures the filter from parameters on the Parameter Server.
      40                 :            :    * This comprehend in order:
      41                 :            :    *    1) algorithm, used for choosing between area and raster algorithm (default=area)
      42                 :            :    *    2)If algorithm is not raster estimationRadius_ is read an a basic check on its sign is made.
      43                 :            :    *      If something is wrong it switches to raster algorithm.
      44                 :            :    *    3) parallelization_enabled, used for choosing between serial and parallel algorithm (default=false)
      45                 :            :    *    4) thread_count, used to set the number of threads to be used in parallelization is enabled (default=auto)
      46                 :            :    * The parallelization_enabled and algorithm parameters allow to choose between the 4 different methods { AreaSerial, AreaParallel,
      47                 :            :    * RasterSerial, RasterParallel }
      48                 :            :    *    4) normal_vector_positive_axis, used to define the upward positive direction for the normals
      49                 :            :    *    5) input_layer, defines in which layer of the grid map lie the information needed (usually elevation or elevation_filtered)
      50                 :            :    *    6) output_layers_prefix, defines the prefix for the new 3 layers (x,y,z) that will define the normal vectors
      51                 :            :    * Those parameters have to be written in a .yaml file that will be processed as a sequence of filters.
      52                 :            :    * An example can be seen in grid_map_demos/config/normal_filter_comparison.yaml.
      53                 :            :    */
      54                 :            :   bool configure() override;
      55                 :            : 
      56                 :            :   /*!
      57                 :            :    * Compute the normal vectors of a layer in a map and
      58                 :            :    * saves it as additional grid map layer.
      59                 :            :    * @param mapIn grid map containing the layer for which the normal vectors are computed for.
      60                 :            :    * @param mapOut grid map containing mapIn and the new layers for the normal vectors.
      61                 :            :    */
      62                 :            :   bool update(const T & mapIn, T & mapOut) override;
      63                 :            : 
      64                 :            : private:
      65                 :            :   /*!
      66                 :            :    * Estimate the normal vector at each point of the input layer by using the areaSingleNormalComputation function.
      67                 :            :    * This function makes use of the area method and is the serial version of such normal vector computation using a
      68                 :            :    * simple for cycle to iterate over the whole map.
      69                 :            :    *
      70                 :            :    * @param map: grid map containing the layer for which the normal vectors are computed for.
      71                 :            :    * @param inputLayer: Layer the normal vector should be computed for.
      72                 :            :    * @param outputLayersPrefix: Output layer name prefix.
      73                 :            :    */
      74                 :            :   void computeWithAreaSerial(
      75                 :            :     GridMap & map, const std::string & inputLayer,
      76                 :            :     const std::string & outputLayersPrefix);
      77                 :            : 
      78                 :            :   /*!
      79                 :            :    * Estimate the normal vector at each point of the input layer by using the areaSingleNormalComputation function.
      80                 :            :    * This function makes use of the area method and is the parallel version of such normal vector computation using
      81                 :            :    * a parallel_for cycle to iterate over the whole map. The parallel_for construct is provided by Intel TBB library.
      82                 :            :    *
      83                 :            :    * @param map: grid map containing the layer for which the normal vectors are computed for.
      84                 :            :    * @param inputLayer: Layer the normal vector should be computed for.
      85                 :            :    * @param outputLayersPrefix: Output layer name prefix.
      86                 :            :    */
      87                 :            :   void computeWithAreaParallel(
      88                 :            :     GridMap & map, const std::string & inputLayer,
      89                 :            :     const std::string & outputLayersPrefix);
      90                 :            : 
      91                 :            :   /*!
      92                 :            :    * Estimate the normal vector at one point of the input layer, specified by the index parameter, by using points within
      93                 :            :    * a circle of specified radius.
      94                 :            :    *
      95                 :            :    * The eigen decomposition of the covariance matrix (3x3) of all data points is used to establish the normal direction.
      96                 :            :    * Four cases can be identified when the eigenvalues are ordered in ascending order:
      97                 :            :    *    1) The data is in a cloud -> all eigenvalues are non-zero
      98                 :            :    *    2) The data is on a plane -> The first eigenvalue is zero
      99                 :            :    *    3) The data is on a line -> The first two eigenvalues are zero.
     100                 :            :    *    4) The data is in one point -> All eigenvalues are zero
     101                 :            :    *
     102                 :            :    * Only case 1 & 2 provide enough information the establish a normal direction.
     103                 :            :    * The degenerate cases (3 or 4) are identified by checking if the second eigenvalue is zero.
     104                 :            :    *
     105                 :            :    * The numerical threshold (1e-8) for the eigenvalue being zero is given by the accuracy of the decomposition, as reported by Eigen:
     106                 :            :    * https://eigen.tuxfamily.org/dox/classEigen_1_1SelfAdjointEigenSolver.html
     107                 :            :    *
     108                 :            :    * Finally, the sign normal vector is correct to be in the same direction as the user defined "normal vector positive axis"
     109                 :            :    *
     110                 :            :    * @param map: grid map containing the layer for which the normal vectors are computed for.
     111                 :            :    * @param inputLayer: Layer the normal vector should be computed for.
     112                 :            :    * @param outputLayersPrefix: Output layer name prefix.
     113                 :            :    * @param index: Index of point in the grid map for which this function calculates the normal vector.
     114                 :            :    */
     115                 :            :   void areaSingleNormalComputation(
     116                 :            :     GridMap & map, const std::string & inputLayer, const std::string & outputLayersPrefix,
     117                 :            :     const grid_map::Index & index);
     118                 :            :   /*!
     119                 :            :    * Estimate the normal vector at each point of the input layer by using the rasterSingleNormalComputation function.
     120                 :            :    * This function makes use of the raster method and is the serial version of such normal vector computation using a
     121                 :            :    * simple for cycle to iterate over the whole map.
     122                 :            :    *
     123                 :            :    * @param map: grid map containing the layer for which the normal vectors are computed for.
     124                 :            :    * @param inputLayer: Layer the normal vector should be computed for.
     125                 :            :    * @param outputLayersPrefix: Output layer name prefix.
     126                 :            :    */
     127                 :            :   void computeWithRasterSerial(
     128                 :            :     GridMap & map, const std::string & inputLayer,
     129                 :            :     const std::string & outputLayersPrefix);
     130                 :            : 
     131                 :            :   /*!
     132                 :            :    * Estimate the normal vector at each point of the input layer by using the rasterSingleNormalComputation function.
     133                 :            :    * This function makes use of the raster method and is the parallel version of such normal vector computation using
     134                 :            :    * a parallel_for cycle to iterate over the whole map. The parallel_for construct is provided by Intel TBB library.
     135                 :            :    *
     136                 :            :    * @param map: grid map containing the layer for which the normal vectors are computed for.
     137                 :            :    * @param inputLayer: Layer the normal vector should be computed for.
     138                 :            :    * @param outputLayersPrefix: Output layer name prefix.
     139                 :            :    */
     140                 :            :   void computeWithRasterParallel(
     141                 :            :     GridMap & map, const std::string & inputLayer,
     142                 :            :     const std::string & outputLayersPrefix);
     143                 :            : 
     144                 :            :   /*!
     145                 :            :    * Estimate the normal vector at one point of the input layer, specified by the index parameter, by using neighboring points
     146                 :            :    * around the point for which the normal vector is being calculated.
     147                 :            :    *
     148                 :            :    * The neighboring cells are used to linearly approximate the first derivative in both directions.
     149                 :            :    *
     150                 :            :    *   |T|   ^
     151                 :            :    * |L|C|R| | x Axis
     152                 :            :    *   |B|   |
     153                 :            :    * <-------|
     154                 :            :    * Y Axis
     155                 :            :    *
     156                 :            :    * Those values are then used to reconstruct the normal vector in the point of interest.
     157                 :            :    * This algorithm doesn't make use of the central cell if all the neighboring point heights are present.
     158                 :            :    * However, thanks to that, it can accommodate missing point heights, up to one in each direction, by using
     159                 :            :    * exactly the central height value.
     160                 :            :    * In this case, the resulting approximation, will suffer a loss of quality depending on the local surface shape.
     161                 :            :    * This implementation skips the outermost values in order to avoid checks on the validity of height values
     162                 :            :    * and therefore have a faster algorithm.
     163                 :            :    *
     164                 :            :    * Inspiration for algorithm: http://www.flipcode.com/archives/Calculating_Vertex_Normals_for_Height_Maps.shtml
     165                 :            :    *
     166                 :            :    * Finally, the sign normal vector is correct to be in the same direction as the user defined "normal vector positive axis"
     167                 :            :    *
     168                 :            :    * @param map: grid map containing the layer for which the normal vectors are computed for.
     169                 :            :    * @param inputLayer: Layer the normal vector should be computed for.
     170                 :            :    * @param outputLayersPrefix: Output layer name prefix.
     171                 :            :    * @param dataMap: Matrix containing the input layer of the grid map in question.
     172                 :            :    * @param index: Index of point in the grid map for which this function calculates the normal vector.
     173                 :            :    */
     174                 :            :   void rasterSingleNormalComputation(
     175                 :            :     GridMap & map, const std::string & outputLayersPrefix, const grid_map::Matrix & dataMap,
     176                 :            :     const grid_map::Index & index);
     177                 :            : 
     178                 :            :   enum class Method { AreaSerial, AreaParallel, RasterSerial, RasterParallel };
     179                 :            : 
     180                 :            :   Method method_;
     181                 :            : 
     182                 :            :   //! Radius of submap for normal vector estimation.
     183                 :            :   double estimationRadius_;
     184                 :            : 
     185                 :            :   //! Parameter that specifies whether to parallelize or not.
     186                 :            :   bool parallelizationEnabled_;
     187                 :            : 
     188                 :            :   //! Parameter that specifies the number of thread used.
     189                 :            :   int threadCount_;
     190                 :            : 
     191                 :            :   //! Normal vector positive axis.
     192                 :            :   Eigen::Vector3d normalVectorPositiveAxis_;
     193                 :            : 
     194                 :            :   //! Input layer name.
     195                 :            :   std::string inputLayer_;
     196                 :            : 
     197                 :            :   //! Output layer name.
     198                 :            :   std::string outputLayersPrefix_;
     199                 :            : 
     200                 :            :   //! Grid Map Resolution.
     201                 :            :   double gridMapResolution_;
     202                 :            : };
     203                 :            : 
     204                 :            : }  // namespace grid_map
     205                 :            : #endif  // GRID_MAP_FILTERS__NORMALVECTORSFILTER_HPP_
